quotes: The 2013 GGE on Developments in the Field of Information and Telecommunications in the Context of International Security agreed in its report that international law applies to cyberspace.
This view was reaffirmed by the subsequent 2015 GGE, which also proposed eleven voluntary and non-binding norms for states.

We are encouraged that the 2019 UN GGE and the new Open-Ended Working Group which deal with behaviour of states and international law, while primarily a forum for inter-governmental consultations, do provide for consultations with stakeholders other than governments, mainly regional organisations.

organizations.name: GGE
quotes: Decisions by the GGE are made on the basis of consensus, including the decision on the final report.

organizations.name: UN General Assembly
quotes: The UN General Assembly welcomed the 2015 report and called on member states to be guided by it in their use of information and communications technologies.

organizations.name: Oman-ITU Arab Regional Cybersecurity Centre
quotes: Examples to build on here include the Oman-ITU Arab Regional Cybersecurity Centre for 22 Arab League countries,

organizations.name: EU’s Computer Security Incident Response Teams (CSIRTs) Network
quotes: Examples to build on here include... the EU’s Computer Security Incident Response Teams (CSIRTs) Network,

organizations.name: Israel’s Cyber Net
quotes: Examples to build on here include... Israel’s Cyber Net, in which public and private teams work together.
